title: OSI and TCP IP Network Models
description: My deep, practical guide to how network communication works, using OSI and TCP IP as mental models you can actually apply for troubleshooting and security.

levels.title: OSI and TCP IP Foundations
levels.label: Foundations
levels.summary: Encapsulation, addressing, and the purpose of layers, explained with exact terms and safe labs.
learning_outcomes: Explain what a protocol is and what a network model is, using precise definitions.
Explain encapsulation and decapsulation using correct protocol data unit names.
Map OSI layers to TCP IP layers and explain what the mapping does and does not mean.
Describe how DNS, HTTP, and HTTPS fit into a real request flow.
Use browser and command line inspection to observe DNS, TLS, and HTTP behaviour safely.

levels.title: Applied OSI and TCP IP
levels.label: Applied
levels.summary: Layer by layer behaviour with TCP, UDP, routing, NAT, and TLS, with realistic troubleshooting.
learning_outcomes: Explain how TCP provides reliability and what reliability means in measurable terms.
Explain UDP trade offs and name common protocols that use it and why.
Explain what routing is and how IP forwarding differs from switching.
Explain what NAT changes and what it does not change, with common failure modes.
Use a structured troubleshooting method to isolate a fault to a layer and prove it.

levels.title: Network Models for Security and Operations
levels.label: Practice & Strategy
levels.summary: Security, monitoring, and operations thinking built on correct network foundations, without unsafe attacking.
learning_outcomes: Explain how common security failures map onto layers and where controls actually apply.
Design a minimal logging and monitoring plan for a web service using layer aware signals.
Explain how to reason about packet captures without turning learning into exploitation.
Describe common enterprise controls such as segmentation, least privilege network access, and secure DNS.
Produce a defensible network troubleshooting write up with evidence and clear assumptions.
